answerText: Adrian Leverkuhn [10] Leverkuhn is the protagonist of Doktor Faustus, a novel by this author of Buddenbrooks and Death in Venice.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Stanford A and Maryland A and University of Illinois at Chicago | 12 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: His interest in music is sparked by listening to the lectures of the scholar Wendell Kretzschmar. For 10 points each:   [10] Name this fictional German composer who sets Love's Labour's Lost to music and is eventually crippled by syphilis.
